info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 2:50PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Swain County through 315 PM EDT... At 249 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northwest of Bryson City, or near Smoky Mountains-Deep Creek, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bryson City, Smoky Mountains-Deep Creek, Cherokee, Smoky Mountains-Clingmans Dome, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Luada, Whittier and Great Smoky Mountains National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
